user_request: A poem for a wedding about soulmates and happily ever after.
final_poem:
Two hearts intertwined, in love' endless stream,  
Bound by affection’s thread on life and dream.   
A soulmate found within each other true;      
Together they shall dance to a happily ever after renewed.     
In passionate embrace under the silver moon's gaze    
Their love story unfolds in sweet enchanted haze,  
Where laughter replaces sorrow’ s cold despair   
And happiness blooms like flowers rare and fair.      
Love that soothes both mind and body alike —                          
In its embrace they find an unshakable strike;    
A bond of love transcends, as years wear on by        
Their souls are etched in joy without the sigh   
Of parting ways. Forever intertwined their hearts beat      
As one entity divine and discreet:                       
Two halves joined to form a whole with no deceit;              
In unity’s dance, they find contentment complete—  
Both in soulmate' s arms forevermore will meet!
